instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> two keys not working on keyboard
threads.message: I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with the "7" and "U" key not working.  Already replaced the keyboard and still same result. Any ideas??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> two keys not working on keyboard
threads.message: Measure all pins of keyboard connector on diode mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> two keys not working on keyboard
threads.message: And don't miss to clean the keyboard connector with alcohol and a toothbrush

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> two keys not working on keyboard
threads.message: One of the traces/vias between <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> and the kb connector could be bad. Follow duke's instructions.
